intro: Mezzettia umbellata, commonly known as the common mezzettia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence, consisting of small white or greenish flowers arranged in umbrella-like clusters. Its leaves are typically pinnately divided, giving it a delicate, fern-like appearance. Mezzettia umbellata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
